timbiriche

a simple version of dots and boxes... good old times.

how to play?

 the rule is simple, everybody:

  - make a friend. (you need one in order to play this, sorry...)
  - line by line, shift by shift, you need to make more full squares than your opponent (friend).
  - BUT your opponent (friend) have the same objective...
  - in the end, who have made more squares, of course, wins.
  - if you made a full square, it's your turn again.  

"why i'ts so ugly?"

In my defense: IT'S A PROTOTYPE. PLEASE, DON'T BE SO MEAN.

why this old game?

yesterday, one of my teachers couldn't go to the class, so we got a 90 minutes of free time.

my friend ana and  me were thinking about playing something, but not as always, like online games and stuff.
so we end up playing tic tac toe...
suddently, one of my friends/classmate came to our table and literally drawed a hundred dots in my sketchbook, ten by ten and sayed: "line by line, don't let the other make a square... go!"

as you can see...

  i love it. (ana won, but we don't need to talk about that...)
